metadata.title: CVE-2019-11723 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability exists during the installation of add-ons where the initialfetch ignored the origin attributes of the browsing context. This couldleak cookies in private browsing mode or across different "containers" forpeople who use the Firefox Multi-Account Containers Web Extension. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
